characters: COMING DOWN THE GRAND OPULENT STAIRCASE
SOME KIND OF BRIGHT SILVER CROSS TRAFFIC
YR OLD BILL/50 YEAR OLD TED
A COURTYARD ON THE CASTLE GROUNDS
YR OLD BILL/55 YR OLD TED
THE 76 STATION ACROSS FROM THE FORUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the THREE MOST IMPORTANT PEOPLE IN THE WORLD float mid-air, gravely looking at the image before them. Super: San Dimas, California, 2713. They turn to a FOURTH MAN - very severe, almost puritanic looking, dressed in all black (ROLLINS).

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Their time is running out. We must take emergency measures. The future of everything hangs in the balance. On Rollins’ face, a slight flash of concern - and surpris He steps into a SLEEK, SILVER METALLIC BOOTH.. dons his SUNGLASSES. And, with a nod to the Great Ones..  The booth shimmers, drops through the floor. Cut to BLACK. Title up: BILL AND TED FACE THE MUSIC Then fade up on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted, in their mid-40’s, in suits, walk up to a microphone. Behind them, a banner reads “CONGRATULATIONS DEACON AND MISSY.” We are at a wedding. Garden-variety, middle class Joanna and Elizabeth are there (also in their mid 40's). Elizabeth is with WILL (18); Joanna is with THEO (also 18 The guys are buoyant, exuberant-- utterly unflappable.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. And welcome to this joyous occasion.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted and I have both known Missy in different capacities for nearly 40 years.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: She was Bill’s babysitter when we were ten, and we both invited her to the prom when she was a senior and we were freshman.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Next she married my dad, and Missy became “Mom.”

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: After quickly divorcing Bill’s dad, Missy married my dad, and became my mom. Ted's dad, POLICE CHIEF CHET LOGAN, now in his mid 60’s a still very fit, raises his glass with a tight smile that barely masks his bitterness.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: And now she is marrying Ted’s younger brother, Officer Deacon Logan. We see DEACON now, 40, buzz cut, with MISSY, now late 40' He raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon - my congratulations. Missy - Bill and I - along with Joanna and Elizabeth, and Will and Theo - welcome you back with open arms. Elizabeth, Joanna, Will and Theo all raise glasses.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: This joyous event would seem to make Deacon his own father-in-law, and make Ted his own uncle.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Not to mention making my dad his own son. In back, Logan just shakes his head, irked on so many lev

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So with that beautiful thought in mind, for your first dance, we wish to present a sneak peek at the world premiere of our newest sonic creation..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So please enjoy the first three movements of..

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: “That Which Binds Us Through Time: The Chemical, Physical and Biological Nature of Love; An Exploration of the Meaning of Meaning.”

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ready, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ready, Ted. One..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Two..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: One two three four.. Ted plays bagpipes. Bill is engaged in a kind of wide- mouthed Aboriginal ‘throat-singing.’ While clearly a grea deal of of this and, in Wedding thought (and even love) has gone into the preparation piece, it is at its core quite difficult to define fact, impossible to enjoy. guests watch with jaw-dropped befuddlement as -  9. Deacon and Missy step to the dance floor - aware that thi somehow their “first dance.” But it’s hard for them to decipher how, exactly, they’re supposed to move to this. Joanna and Elizabeth exchange a glance. As do Will and Th Ted’s dad just openly throws his hands up..

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. .»-and crosses to a power bank and literally pulls the pl the whole thing. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THIRTY SECONDS LATER
dialogues.text: Ted and his dad, off to the side of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you don’t get it, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: No one gets it, Ted. No one ever has. There’s nothing to get.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: They will, Dad, seriously.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. That song is the worst one yet. And that’s saying a lot. I told Deacon he should never have let you guys play. I’m sorry, “play.” And honestly - on a very deep level - it is time to pull the plug. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We can’t. We have to pursue this until --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah yeah, I know, until your “music saves the world.” Ted. Enough with your delusions. While this continues we CUT AWAY TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: Where Bill wheels equipment to the back door. He pulls it open and sees - his FATHER, BOB PRESTON, slumped in the b having just been awakened.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Hey dad.  10.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: How was the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: It was good. You shoulda come in.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: Weddings are hard for me, Billy. My social worker says I’ve never really recovered from your mom leaving all those years ago. Your real mom, not Missy.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know. That was hard. Mr. Preston gives Bill a huge hug.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: I love you, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know, Dad. And I love you, too. (as his dad continues to hug him) Okay, Dad. It’s totally fine. Everything's good, Dad. Everything’s gonna be okay. I really gotta go get some more stuff. He breaks off, turns. And we follow him to --

dialogues.speaker: TED AND LOGAN
dialogues.text: Still in the thick of it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dad - I’m just saying: if you’d done the things me and Bill have done, and seen the things we've seen --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: No - you can keep “spinning” this however you want, Ted, but I’1l never believe it. You didn’t time travel. You didn’t die and go to hell and then come back.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Chief Logan - we did -

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: No. You didn’t, Bill. And here’s the reason you didn’t: it’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dad - I know you’re upset because Deacon just married --  11.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: No. Ted - you’re wrong. It has nothing to do with that. Trust me, if I’m more disappointed in one of my sons, it’s you. Logan spins to storm away. Then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way? That five thousand dollars I loaned you? I want it back.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You'll get it back.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF LOGAN
dialogues.text: When, Ted? You’re upside down on your mortgage. You’re fifty thousand dollars in debt. Your wife is working two jobs so you two can pursue your pathetic fantasy. Get real, Ted. Get real - both of you. And he’s off. Ted just stands there. Bill puts his hand o Ted’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - if it’s any consolation, I’m eighty- thousand dollars in debt.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do? MAN’S VOICE (PRELAP) No. No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys and coat in hand, the stadium manager (FRANK) closes office door as Bill and Ted follow him out into the arena

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No, you may not have your non-refundable deposit back.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No ‘buts.’ Twenty years ago you signed a contract - put down a deposit - to rent the Forum tomorrow night for your concert celebrating “Two Decades of Greatness--”

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Triumphance.  12.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Whatever. I tell you this every year--

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But this year is different.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: It’s quite different - as you will see if you'd simply listen to us.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Fine. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: This year, given the direness of our financial situation, we’re willing to reduce our offer from a one hundred percent refund to an eighty percent refund.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So wait - I’m sorry - then I’d only have to give you eighty thousand dollars that I contractually do not owe you rather than a hundred thousand?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Correct. But between us, our bottom line is sixty thousand, for which we will take forty.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But no lower than twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Of which we would accept ten. Ted leans to Bill.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - I have a sneaking feeling that we're negotiating against ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Good point, Ted. (turns ) Forget everything we said. We’re back at a hundred thousand. Plus interest.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay, then I guess I should make my counter offer: nothing. The point is: you bought the Forum tomorrow night - it’s yours. Do whatever you want with it - throw a party at mid-field, I don’t care. The lights’ll be on, the gate’1ll be open. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way - just out of curiosity - how many tickets have you guys sold?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well, it’s hard to say - it could have changed, cause we haven’t checked the web site in a while.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's fine. Just give me the ballpark number.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay - ballpark? I’m just estimating here, but approximately zero. Frank shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I have to tell you guys - what you have pulled off here is very impressive, ina way. You’ve promoted a concert for twenty years, and sold zero tickets.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s not a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Joanna ride up in silence. They get off and ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Joanna stops as she sees: Elizabeth and Ted, also in waiting room. Elizabeth is equally surprised. Ted is not.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How’s it goin’ dude? Hey, Jo!

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry - is this the right day?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. Totally. Couples therapy.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: But.. Now the other door opens and the THERAPIST sticks his hea out - a bit surprised to see TWO couples in his waiting r  14. INT. THERAPIST’S OFFICE - A MOMENT LATER Bill, with Joanna, and Ted, with Elizabeth, sit across fr the Therapist. It’s a little crowded on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: So do you understand why this situation might seem at all strange to your wives?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No, not at all. Why?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Well, when your wives suggested couples therapy, did you think this is what they had in mind?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. Definitely. I mean, we’re a couple of couples, right?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Well, it usually means one couple.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Ohhh..

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: But since you’re here - let me ask you this. Is there something you feel your wives need to hear from you?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. Totally. (turning to Elizabeth) We love you guys.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s good. But.. Do you understand how that might sound strange to your wives? Bill?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: No. We love em.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: “We” love them?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah, we do.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: “We" do?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah, we do. Exactly.  15.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: It’s the “we” part.. Ted. Can you say the same thing using “I” in the sentence?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Yah, of course. (turns to Elizabeth) Elizabeth. I - and Bill - love you - and Joanna. Elizabeth just stares at the floor, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude. All due respect - I don’t think you're getting this.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Go for it, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Okay. (turns ) Joanna. From the very very bottom of I - and Ted’s - hearts. I - and Ted - totally love and worship you - and Elizabeth. Bill beams. Ted nods - as if he now sees.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Joanna, would you or Elizabeth like to respond? Elizabeth indicates “go ahead.”

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Well.. Okay. I know you love me, Bill. However - and I can’t speak for Elizabeth, but.. you guys are gone over two hundred nights a year. Every time you go out on tour to make money, you come back deeper in debt.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But we have to --

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I know. I know it’s a burden for you. And I know you feel as though you have to do it yourselves. But you don’t. We literally left everything behind, our families, our friends..

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We moved 600 years in the future to be with you. To be your partners. But it’s like all you think about is the song..  16.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: The mission..

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And it’s like we and the boys are not even there.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So.. Wait. What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I guess what I’m saying is.. If things don’t change.. I don’t know how much longer I can go on like this. Ted is stunned. He looks at Bill. Bill turns to Joanna.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Do you feel the same way? Joanna nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Elizabeth, in tense silence. Ted glances over - s just stares straight ahead. They pull up to the end of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where TWO HOUSES share a driveway at the end of a quiet middle-class street. As they pull in -- A GEO METRO is already there, and Bill and Joanna are get out - also with palpable tension between them. (What is clear to us now is: they all live right next doo to each other, and share a driveway - and garage.) As the women head towards the Logan house, Bill and Ted j each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - things are worse than I thought. I think they're actually thinking about leaving us.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know, it’s bad. But we still got our work to do.. They look at their wives, who are conferring at the front door.  17.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay - let’s just try and work sorta fast.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. Totally. As they start toward the GARAGE-- suddenly we HEAR the so of GUITARS from within. Ted exhales heavily.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’ve told Will over and over.. They pull the garage door open, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Theo are playing classic old guitars (the very o that Bill and Ted played at the end of “Bogus Journey."”) They immediately stop, look at their fathers.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: How’s it goin, dad?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Out!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: This is our studio - and those are our guitars. He and Bill pull the guitars from their sons’ hands.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We have important work to do, and we can’t have you messing around in here.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You wanna at least see what we’ve been working on? Will holds a piece of paper out. Ted takes it, shoves it his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Later. But right now, we need the studio. (a beat) Now, please, Will.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Okay, Grampa.  18. The boys shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I told you, dude. It’s always the same. Let’s just go play up in my room. With our crappy guitars. Will nods and the boys head out. Bill and Ted watch them guilty, as Ted shuts the garage door and we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted are working on a song; struggling. Bill is noodling on the synthesizer - Ted is scratching out lyric

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, I added a couple things. Go again. Bill starts on the synthesizer: it’s abstruse, complex (n in a good way) - like D-grade Bohemian Rhapsody.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “We try - y - y - y to carry--yy.. on. Ayiii-eee-ee-ee-ee. .a-000-00-00-00.” Ted stops. Bill picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: “OQoEEEE-eeee-YIYIYIYI..” (to Ted) Dude - run with me. I think we’re onto something... (resuming) “We straaa—aaaa-aaa-aaa-aain..yiyi-yi-yi-- ”

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - seriously. Stop. I hate to say this, but we’re NOT onto anything.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I think it’s our best one yet.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - if that’s true - then things are even worse than I thought. Cause this song sucks. You do know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I don’t agree.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude.  19.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill - come on. It’s me. You don’t have to spin me. It sucks. All our songs suck. What are we doing? Seriously. Our wives are mad at us, our sons are mad at us, we're broke-- why are we even doing this?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We're doing it cause we have to! Ted - we're supposed to save all humanity.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Says who??

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Those people - from the future --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What if they were wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How could they be wrong? We saw the future - we were there.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Alls I know is, at this moment, I feel like for the last 20 years we've been beating our heads against a wall, and it hurts, and I wanna stop.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But we can’t! We promised!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna care? Seriously. I’m sick of it. And you know you are too. Bill just looks at Ted - for a long moment - and then he deflates, dropping the facade.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Okay. Yah. I’m totally sick of it. But I thought if I ever admitted it - to you or me - we’d completely crumble. There’s a pause.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I can’t do this any more. I just can’t. Another pause. Finally Bill looks at Ted.. And nods, agreeing. Then, suddenly, there’s --  20. A FLASH of LIGHT outside, visible under the garage door.. Then: We HEAR a metallic WHOOSH.. Then FOOTSTEPS. Someone Or something.. is outside. Bill and Ted look at each other, walk toward the garage d and slowly open it, revealing-- The futuristic BOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoa.. And next to the booth, emerging from its shadow, ROLLINS.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Come with me, please.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Are you from the future?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Yes. A beat. The guys look at each other again.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Are you mad at us?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: We have very little time. He opens the door for them. Ted leans closer to Bill.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I think we’re in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Relax, Ted. They totally love us in the future. The guys get into the sleek, elegant booth. Rollins close the door, and in an instant.. It shimmers.. and DISAPPEAR

dialogues.speaker: INT. CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: Dark. Misty. Glimpses of light. We hear a WHOOOSH and the silver booth soars past in blur.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted - stunned, amazed - gape out at the circuits time.. for the first time in a long time. And we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth appears and touches down on the floor. Rollins gets out, followed by Bill and Ted. Bill and Ted whisper:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I think I liked Rufus better.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Me too. (turns to Rollins) What is it you do here, dude?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: I clean up messes. The guys look at each other as they hear..

dialogues.speaker: BOOMING VOICE
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted. Step closer please. Now they turn and see: THREE IMPOSING FIGURES-- who look at Bill and Ted with ba restrained urgency and frustration. They are fierce, unblinking. It’s dark and intense. Bill and Ted look at each other, swallow. Around the room is a kind of “Senate” of observers who li the walls. Bill adopts an upbeat manner.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How’s it goin’? Good to be back again. Lookin’ great.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: What do you have to say for yourselves?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh.. They look at each other, then adopt their arm-raised post  22.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Be excellent to each other..?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And.. party on, dudes..? Dead silence. No smiles. No nods. Nothing but scowls.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Where's the song? The guys eyes widen..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh.. The song.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Which one? We've written so many.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: The song. The song that will fulfill your destiny. The one that is to be played at the Fabulous Forum tomorrow night. The one that will save the world as we know it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh, yah. That song. We definitely have that song. Yah. The Leader makes a gesture. Lights come up and suddenly a around them are MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS of all shapes and siz

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Then play it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Like right now?

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: We need to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Um.. Before we do that --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Which we very much look forward to doing --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And are most eminently prepared to do --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Being as it’s already written --  A pause. 23.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And is very good on the level of lyrics, and melody, and rhythmic aspects as well as meter and, you know, thematic content.. we need to..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Tweak..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. MTweak..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Or, even better, perhaps what would expedite this entire process..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Would be if you played the song for us right now.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Or perhaps played it several times.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Or even just give us a recording. So we may be certain we have the exact rendition of our greatest song ever written..

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: You don’t have it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What?! No. Just the opposite.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: In fact, our problem is we have so many great songs that as we put together our set list for the concert tomorrow night --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: The one we in no way bailed on years ago --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And which as recently as an hour ago did not try to get our money back from -

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Right, that did not happen..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You're not watching us all the time, are you?  24. Silence. Then the Leader just waves his arms and THE FLOATING GREAT FIGURES DISAPPEAR INTO DARKNESS -- as do t instruments, and instantly-- Rollins is standing right in front of the guys.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: The window of destiny is closing. You have twenty four hours to come up with the song.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But-- What if for some reason we don’t?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Which would be most paradoxical because obviously we do already have it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But, you know, just theoretically.. cause we are intrigued with all manner of thought experiment involving, you know, “the conundrum of time”..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So-- What would happen? Rollins looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Come with me. He turns. The guys look at each other, then follow him as two huge doors slide open and they all enter --

dialogues.speaker: A CATHEDRAL-LIKE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Built solely to house:

dialogues.speaker: A HOLOGRAPHIC TIME-LINE
dialogues.text: Ethereal, majestic, floating in mid-air. Weaving and wind from the deepest past all the way to the present - and, still, moment by moment, continuing to inch forward.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: This is time. It’s the path through which the past connects with the present.. and leads to the future.  25. The guys move closer. Now they can see that the “weave” i actually a collection of INFINITESIMALLY SMALL BITS OF INFORMATION. Rollins reaches out and TOUCHES a section, in the way one might touch, say, an iPad. As he does.. ROLLINS (CONT’D) 1945. --an IMAGE FROM 1945 balloons out: Hiroshima. He removes his finger - the image recedes. He touches another spot.. ROLLINS (CONT’D) 1989. .--and out balloons an image of the Man standing in front the tank in Tiananmen Square. ROLLINS (CONT’D) Time is more fluid, and more contingent, than you understand. There are key moments in the weave - turning points - like stitches, if you want to think of them that way. And when one is missing, then everything can fray.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Has that ever happened?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: It’s about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Meaning..?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: If you don’t have the song in 24 hours, time as we all know it will essentially unravel. Forward, and backward.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth appears. The guys get out, still in shock. Rollins gives Ted a TIMEPIECE of some sort.. like a reall cool, sleek WATCH.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Keep a close eye on this. You have 24 hours. When it runs out, it’s over.  26. Rollins crosses back to his booth and gets in.. And, with nod at them, he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Okay - bad news: the whole unraveling of time thing could be most heinous. Good news: This means there is a song. Otherwise they wouldn’t be so mad at us for not having it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: --Yah. I think that’s probably right.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So now, alls we gotta do is stop writing songs that totally suck, and just write the greatest song ever written. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: .-Yah.. I guess. Bill starts into the garage. Ted remains on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, what are you doing, dude? We gotta keep going.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I just don’t get it.. I mean-- We’ve been trying for 20 years to write the greatest song ever written. How are we gonna do it in 24 hours?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I don’t know.. But we gotta. (beat) I mean.. Right? What else are we gonna do, dude? Ted nods - distant and distracted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But we do know the song’s gonna exist, right?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well, yah.. at some point..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I just wish there was a way that we could go into the future and get it from ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How would we do that?  27. There’s a pause. They look at each other, sharing a slowl dawning realization.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could we actually...?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Couldn't we..?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But-- didn’t Rufus say we could only do that in an extreme emergency?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill-- if the future of all of reality as we know it is at stake.. isn’t that an extreme emergency? EXT. BILL’S HOUSE - NIGHT - MOMENT LATER The guys head towards a STORAGE SHED at the very back of property. At the shed, they undo a series of heavy metal padlocks. The door opens.. a single light bulb is switched on..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys walk to the darkest, most shadowy corner and sta to pull a series of covers, sheets, tarps, etc., off of w gradually reveals itself as.. THE PHONE BOOTH.. The old one from the earlier movies. It’s dusty, rusted, obviously hasn’t been used in 20 year

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Okay, so here’s the plan: We go into the future to when we've actually written the song, find ourselves, and take it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: One question: Is that stealing?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Why would it be stealing if we’re getting it from ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, yah.. (eyeing the booth) You think it still works?  28.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out, dude..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in. Dust off the key pad.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How far into the future do you think we need to go?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Depends on when we think we’re gonna write the song.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I say definitely within the next year or two.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well, let’s be conservative. Say five years?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Sounds good. (a pause) You wanna do the honors, or should I?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Go for it, dude. Ted - with not a little bit of nostalgia and a good deal trepidation.. starts to hit the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: San Dimas, California.. Five years from now. At first, nothing happens. It’s like starting a car that’ been sitting in the garage for 20 years. Then-- the light in the booth flicker on... there is a low humming/buzzing sound. As the antenna comes to life, illuminating the dar shed, the guys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bill..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I have a feeling things are just about to change in a most outstanding way.  29.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, I totally agree. And with an exuberant, super-optimistic AIR GUITAR..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Let’s go save the world, dude! ..the booth shimmers and DISAPPEARS and we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: INT. CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: Whhhoooshhhhhh. The booth sails through the circuits of t which are sleeker, faster than when last we sailed throug The guys look through the glass - thrilled, moved: neithe thought he'd ever be doing this again.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know.. The booth veers off, disappears into a circuit and we cut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the marquee: “OPEN MIC NIGHT.” We hear a faint version of Huey Lewis’ “The Heart of Rock'n Roll” coming from ins a sad version - kind of pathetic; earnest and overly sinc Super: San Dimas, California - five years into the future The booth APPEARS lands in the parking lot. The guys step out, look around - hear the music from within..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So where are the future us’s?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah - you'd think we’d be waiting for ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We gotta remember to be more polite and come out and greet ourselves next time. (notices something) Oh no..  30. Bill turns - follows Ted’s gaze into --

dialogues.speaker: THE LOUNGE
dialogues.text: Where ON STAGE - in front of a dozen bored businessmen -

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: In black vests, white shirts, earrings - singing “Heart o Rock'n Roll.” 50 Yr Old Bill is working a little harder t push it across; 50 Yr Old Ted just seems depressed. (And the years have not been kind to their voices. Ted’s gotten lower - and is now a rumbly Kris Kristofferson cro Bill’s is now a kind of high, nasally Art Garfunkel whine

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/TED
dialogues.text: T-T-T-THEY SAY THE HEAR OF ROCK’N ROLL IS STILL BEATIN’, AND FROM WHAT I’VE SEEN I BELIEVE ‘EM; NOW THE OLD BOY MAY BE BARELY BREATHIN’.. BUT THE HEART OF ROCK’N ROLL. (a sort of harmony) THE HEART OF ROCK’N ROLL IS STILL BEATIN’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back, Bill and Ted enter, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: No way.. They say it just loud enough that on stage, 50 Yr Old Bil hears them - and looks up.. Which makes 50 Yr Old Ted do same thing. Now, like deer in headlights: 50 Yr Old Bill and Ted freeze. If the audience were payin attention, they’d notice the two sets of Bills and Teds a standing motionless, staring at each other, but no one ca There’s an odd moment where they all stand, staring. Then 50 Year Old Bill and Ted turn and bolt through the back e Bill and Ted look at each other - and sprint across the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 Year Old Bill and Ted scramble in their dress shoes ac the parking lot and race toward the (now quite beaten up) with their guitars. A beat later -

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Wait! Bill!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ted!  31. They race to the van, where 50 Yr Old Bill and Ted are opening the doors.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey - us’s. Stop. Older Bill and Ted turn - busted. Instantly (and lamely) they try and cover.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Ohhh! Hello!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: We totally forgot you guys were coming! How great to see you!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You totally ran away from us!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Oh - that’s just because.. in the darkness, we thought you were groupies, which we have a lot of. Bill and Ted look around the deserted back parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Oh, yah - absolutely. 50 Year Old Ted nervously pulls a flask from his hip pock and takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Look - dudes - we know exactly what you’re thinking: why are we playing here at open mic night at the Holiday Inn in San Dimas, when in fact, we are such huge rock stars with lots of groupies?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: And here's the answer: Us being here is humorously ironic.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Do you believe us?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I remember not necessarily believing it when I you was standing there listening to I me.  32.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: But this time you really can believe us. (pause) Do you believe us?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Not at all. 50 Year Old Ted takes another (this time bigger) gulp fro his flask. As he wipes his mouth with his sleeve:

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: (vaguely belligerent) Well I feel sorry for you then.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Do you have the song?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Do we have the song? Do we have the song?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ted. Stop drinking for a minute and look me in the eye. Do you have the song? 50 Yr Old Ted almost looks Ted in the eye: at his eyebrow between his eyes.. But not in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. In the eye. Look me in the eye, Ted, and tell me you have the song. Otherwise we're gonna leave right now. Do you have the song or do you not? (beat; shakes his head sadly) You totally don’t have the song, do you?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: (finishing his entire flask) You know what? Screw you, me.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/50 YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa!/Easy, Ted -

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: No - not easy. (to Bill and Ted) YOU didn’t write the song. YOU’RE the ones who're responsible for all of this. And you know something else, pretty boy?  33.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Don’t call me that.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: “Don’t call me that.” “Dude.” You drove the princesses away.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Whoa. Wait. What did you say? The princesses are gone?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t act so surprised. They basically told you they were gonna leave. Well, guess what? As soon as you got back from this stupid, failed mission - they were gone.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How??

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: No idea. Alls we know is they left a note saying they took Will and Theo back to 1428 and they never came back - and now we've been alone for five years cause you drove our wives away.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Our wives have been gone for five years and you haven’t even tried to talk to them?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Oh - you did, alright - you just made it worse! They had their doubts about you, which you were totally missing, I might add.. and then you went back to Medieval England and confirmed every one of em!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: There is no way we did that.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Yah well you’re gonna eat your words in about 45 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Not true. Ted - let’s go talk to our wives right now and set this straight.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Fine. I’m done with you two losers.  34. Ted lunges for himself. Grabs himself --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Why don’t you take some responsibility, you drunk!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go knit a blob?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Blob-knitter!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You’re rude! Get your act together, Ted!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: You get your act together, Ted! The two Bills grab the two Teds - who are inches from throttling each other - and pull them apart.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted - back away - he’s not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: He’s right. Don’t let that punk get to you. 50 Year Old Ted backs down. Bill turns Ted around.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Let’s go clean up the mess those us’s made. As Older Bill and Ted open the van doors, Bill and Ted se BILL'S FATHER, in back, in a sleeping bag.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: Hi boys. How was the gig? Bill stops - eyes wide. Turns to his older self.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You live with Dad in the van?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (takes Bill’s shoulder) Walk away, dude. Walk away. As Bill and Ted make their way across the lot:

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD TED
dialogues.text: If you don’t like it - go fix it!  35.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Yah! Go write the song yourself instead of trying to steal it from us!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Or do something-- cuz our lives suck and it’s your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys approach - and get into - the booth.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Those older us’s were jerks.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I know. I can’t believe how much I hated my me.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know. But we did learn something quite important from them. We gotta go back to England.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. What’s the point of any of this is we don’t got our families? The phone booth starts to shimmer - the guys turn, prepar for it to drop. And just as it starts to - Bill and Ted’s eyes widen as they think they see - about feet away across the parking lot: ROLLINS in his silver booth, eyeing them as if studying t But before Bill and Ted have a chance to react (or even b sure what they’ve seen), their booth drops.. and we cut t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanna and Elizabeth - in 1428 attire - are at a table in courtyard, chatting with family and friends. Will and The in modern attire - are also there, chatting amiably with their grandparents: the Duke and Duchess of North Umberla

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: --graduated in June, now we’re just working on the music.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: And what kind of music is that?  There’s a 36.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It’s a blend of classic old guitar with techno.. Kinda neo-bluesy.. but actually, without any place to plug in, it’s gonna be a little hard to keep playing.

dialogues.speaker: DUCHESS
dialogues.text: “Plug in” to what?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That’s a little complicated, Grandma.. flash in the distance and-- EXT. MEDIEVAL ENGLAND —- DAY The booth lands in a field and the guys get out, look ove toward the castle and see.. Joanna and Elizabeth - on horseback - riding toward them. The wives

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Whatever we do, let’s not give those other us’s the satisfaction of making things worse.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. We definitely won’t. arrive and dismount.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What are you two doing here? We need some time away.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Right. And we totally respect that. But first: how did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: That nice man from the future showed up and asked if we needed anything. And we told him we would very much like to come home for a while.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: So he brought us here. Bill and Ted exchange a glance: “Why would he do that?” T turns to Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay. We know you’re thinking very seriously of leaving us.  37.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: .-What? No, we’re not.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes you are - you just don’t realize it yet, you think you’re just here for a visit, but you’re totally gonna stay. Off the women’s confused looks:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Full disclosure: we just saw ourselves five years in the future - and you have every reason to leave us because the truth is: we’re going to become everything you don’t want us to be.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We're just sad pathetic losers living in the van with my dad--

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Drinking too much --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: And lying. You can’t believe what oily liars we are.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And - get this: we tried to tell ourselves not to come here. Like we were somehow going to make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Which is ridiculous - cause knowing what we know we’re only making it better, right?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Wait - what are you talking about? In five years you’re living in a van - with your dad - drinking too much? The guys realize they might actually be making things wor The women are starting to eye them differently: worried, in a way they weren't before.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Exactly! Which is why we’re trying to change that by finding the song.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Because if we don’t find it, it’s gonna be a lot worse than even that.  38.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah, like all of reality will completely unravel.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But don’t worry about that, cuz apparently the future is fluid.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Exactly. You can change it if you do the right things at the right times.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Like coming here and talking to you now.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I’m not entirely sure it was the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, maybe those future you’s were a little bit right.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Why were you drinking so much, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I haven’t started yet - I can’t answer that.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Maybe we do need a little more time than we thought.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What? No! Elizabeth, I‘1l go to AA!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: But you don’t even drink.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yet! But I’m about to!

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I think we’d like you to leave now.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: And you don’t want to come with us?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Are you paying any attention?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Fine. We’re gonna go. But you need to understand: We’re gonna keep going till we succeed on our mission.  39.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah, we’re gonna find the song. We’re gonna save the world.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And we’re gonna be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill’s at the keypad as a determined Ted closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Five years forward was clearly not enough. Let’s go ten this time. We certainly will have written the song by then.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude, I strongly believe we’re about to see our lives get a whole lot better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth roars past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a flash, the booth arrives in a very nice, hilly sec of town. City lights lay out. The “Bel Air” of San Dimas. Super: San Dimas, California - 10 years in the future Bill and Ted step out of the booth and immediately see:

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD FASHIONED BRITISH BUTLER
dialogues.text: Standing calmly, towel over arm.

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: Masters Logan and Preston.. Welcome home, gentlemen. The Butler opens a gate and leads the amazed guys into..

dialogues.speaker: THE MOST BEAUTIFUL HOME IMAGINABLE
dialogues.text: Six car garage, gardens, fountains, huge view. In the driveway: a Bentley, a Range Rover, a Porsche, a 65 Musta

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude.. We did it! Look at where we live.  40.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah - and look at what we’re driving. One song did all this?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted - what if it wasn’t just one song? What if after we wrote it, the dam broke and they just kept coming and coming? Subtle air guitar as the Butler ceremoniously opens the d

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: The masters of the house are on the way down. Might I offer you a spot of champagne? He extends a tray with four flutes of champagne. The guys take two, then hear casual laughter and see..

dialogues.speaker: COMING DOWN THE GRAND OPULENT STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: 55 YR OLD BILL AND TED, wearing expensive clothes and jewelry. Whereas 55 Yr Old Bill’s clothes are loose, flowing; 55 Yr Old Ted’s are tighter, more form-fitting. Bill’s hair is long and flowing; Ted's is “casually unkem

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Why hello younger us’s.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Quel plaiser a vous voir.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - I speak French?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Oui, monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Excellent!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: I think you mean.. Excellente. 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted raise their champagne flutes.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: To your futures.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So, then.. I guess you have the song?  41.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Why would we be living like this if we didn't?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And the princesses..?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Brace yourselves.. Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: They're back. (as Bill and Ted audibly exhale) They've been back for a while. And things are better than ever. Huge loads are lifted from Bill and Ted’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s such a relief.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: (a hand on Ted’s shoulder) I know you feel that way, Ted. And it’s all gonna be good.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: And - do you know why that happened? Because a certain chanson changed the lives of two gentlemen named Bill and Ted..

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: But enough prologue. We know the time is slipping by on that crazy clock of yours. This way. 55 Year Old Bill and Ted lead the guys past a SUNKEN LIVI ROOM, where they hear: MR. PRESTON’S VOICE Salutations, boys!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dad!? BILL'S FATHER sits on the sofa, dressed in a pashmina caf He raises his own champagne flute - and a small silver tr  42.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: Caviar?

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: In a moment dad - we’re gonna play em the song first.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: You're in for a treat, boys! Enjoy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted follow 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted down a hallway lined with POSTERS, GOLD RECORDS, MAGAZINE COVERS -- all Bill and Ted on the cover. We see: “BILLBOARD NUMBER ONE SONG 131 WEEKS IN A ROW!”

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoa..

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: (to 55 Yr Old Bill) Remember that?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Like it was yesterday. And I remember me saying -- 55 YR OLD BILL (CONT’D) BILL Whoa! Ted! Check out the Whoa! Ted! Check out the cover of Rolling Stone, dude! cover of Rolling Stone, dud Bill points to a cover that says “Q: CAN A SONG CHANGE TH WORLD? A: TOTALLY!”

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: And I remember the feeling I had when we us’s showed you us’s into our somewhat nice recording studio. They open a double-door and Bill and Ted follow them into

dialogues.speaker: A SPECTACULAR MUSIC STUDIO
dialogues.text: Beyond state of the art. Instruments everywhere. Clearly lot of great music has been - and is being - made here.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: No way..

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/55 YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Yes way, Bill and Ted.  43.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So it worked! Our plan worked!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Of course it worked. You guys totally took the song - the one we’re about to play for you - played it at the Forum - the girls were there - and it changed everything.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Wait - we’re gonna play that concert?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We haven’t even sold one ticket.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Remember: reality is fluid.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But what about the guys we just saw? Those loser us’s from 5 years ago?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Dudes - you’ve been told this before:

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: That reality will only happen if you don’t take this song back with you. Those guys don't need to exist. Trust me, Ted - it’s amazing how fast life can change when you do the right things.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: But you guys gotta make it happen.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We will, we will. 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted point to two very plush seats - wh the guys sit.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I must say, Ted, as much as I disliked those previous us’s, I like these us’s.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Okay! Enough talking. Are you ready to face the music? Bill and Ted nod as 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted put the most spectacular pair of over-the-ear EARPHONES on them.. And, with a nod and a wink at the guys, and at each other they move to the soundboard and hit PLAY.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: The moment they’ve been waiting for for twenty years is h And - though we only hear the barest, most muffled SENSE music from beneath the headphones - from the very first moment we can tell that it’s not disappointing. A tear is forming in Bill’s eye. Ted looks stunned - deep impressed, but it’s more complex than that. And while this is happening, we CUT AWAY TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security gate starts to slowly open as a HUGE WHITE L pulls up in the street outside the mansion. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For reasons that are unclear to us, the BUTLER sees the headlights and suddenly snuffs his cigarette out on the floor, spins and bolts through the kitchen, and out a doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the guys as the song ends. Bill’s in tears. Ted’ in disbelief. They slowly pull the headphones off.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That is truly the most amazing song I’ve ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah.. It’s great. Honestly? I wouldn’t’ve thought we had it in us.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Well you do, and now it’s time to get it out to the world.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I don’t even know how to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: (re Ted’s watch) You guys should probably get going. Bill nods, shakes his older self’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I‘’1l never forget you, Bill.  45.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Right back atcha, Billy boy. The handshake turns into an affectionate bearhug. Ted loo at his older self.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well... so long, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Yah, so long. They nod to each other - somehow slightly wary of each ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys head out, Bill looks over at Ted, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude. Why were you acting so weird with yourself?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I just got a weird feeling.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You always have a weird feeling when you're with other you's.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I know, I gotta stop being so suspicious of myself.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah, you do, cuz it’s all gonna be fine. They reach the front door and throw it open, extremely surprised to see --

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE VAN HALEN
dialogues.text: Standing there, a suitcase at his side, a guitar case slu over his shoulder - his house keys out, about to open the front door.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE VAN HALEN
dialogues.text: Wyld Stallyns?? What the hell are you doing in my house?

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Eddie Van Halen?!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: This is our house, dude.  46.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE VAN HALEN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: This is our house - or at least the house of future us’s.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE VAN HALEN
dialogues.text: You two need to leave right now or I’m calling the cops.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: No, you need to leave right now, Eddie Van Halen - or we’ll call the cops. Suddenly - Ted slams the door and slides the deadbolt. He turns and starts purposefully down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh no, oh no oh no oh no..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted are undressing - as actors would a a performance. It’s now obvious why their clothes didn’t well: because they’re both wearing Eddie Van Halen’s clot and he’s bigger than Bill and smaller than Ted. Bill removes his WIG - revealing that he is almost totall bald (except a thin strip of Friar Tuck hair at the back)

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: I think we totally fooled those other us's. Ted pulls his shirt off, revealing he is wearing a MALE GIRDLE. He loosens it - he’s easily 80 pounds overweight.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I hope so. I didn’t like the way I was looking at myself.. Ted downs a long, long swig of Eddie Van Halen’s VODKA.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Ted has stopped, is staring at one of the magazine covers

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What is it?  47. Ted nods to the cover which, when you look at it more carefully, is very obviously “photo-shopped.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted raise their glasses in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Now.. We wait for those other us’s to go back and change everything.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: To our lives gettin’ a whole lot better. (then) Ted - seriously - slow down on the vodka, dude. Now the door flies open and Bill and Ted, enraged, storm

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You guys totally lied to us!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, why haven’t you taken the song back to the Fabulous Forum?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Maybe cuz it’s not our song!?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/50 YEAR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Ch (feigning shock) What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: It’s Eddie Van Halen’s song, he wrote it. And this is his house.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: On what basis would you say something so utterly ridiculous?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Cuz we just ran into him. He’s outside, calling the cops. Older Bill turns to Older Ted, frustrated and annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, I told you Eddie Van Halen came back this week.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I totally thought he came back next week. The two younger guys look at their older selves, shocked.  48.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You're totally bald, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And you're a fat drunk, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/55 YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Heyyyyyy--

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What on earth were you guys even thinking?? Older Bill and Ted get up, cross to their younger selves.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: What were we thinking? That we had the perfect plan, and we still do.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: (nodding) Just cuz you two couldn’t come up with a great song and Eddie Van Halen did doesn’t mean we should be punished for that.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What? That doesn’t even make sense. There is the sound of sirens outside.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: You gotta go right now.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: No way, it’s not our song.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Take it now and it will be yours. When Eddie Van Halen comes up with it in 10 years, he'll be stealing it from you.

dialogues.speaker: BILL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I think it’s a great idea, Ted. We should leave right now and do exactly what the wise older us’s say - regardless of what I might say immediately following this sentence.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude! No! He’s ventriloquizing me! 55 Yr Old Bill shrugs - “innocent.”  49.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We're not gonna do it, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Fine. I guess saving the world is just irrelevant to you now.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You're not interested in saving the world - all you care about is saving your own pathetic lives.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Wrong.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Your blatant cynicism is both transparent and appalling, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Fine. Maybe you'll care about this: taking the song is your only chance to get the princesses back.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (as if punched in the gut) You were lying about that.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Of course we were lying. They don’t want to have anything to do with you. Cause they think you’re losers. Which you are. Cause you make bad choices. Like this.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’m so disappointed in you, me.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I don’t care what you think of me, Ted. Our life is hell and if you don’t go back and change it --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh - it’s all about you --

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Ted and Ted - take it easy - this plan will work - everyone’s life will be better if you guys just would -- There’s loud pounding on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: OS VOICE
dialogues.text: It's the police, open up!  50.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: So what do you say - are you gonna do it or not?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: No way, dude. You had ten years to write the song --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And we're not gonna build a fake future on one that’s not even ours. 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Fine. He and 55 Yr Old Ted pull out GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Then we’ll do it. We’ll take the song, and the booth, and we’ll go back.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: This is our third strike, and we’re not going back to jail, I can tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dudes - seriously - you don’t have to pull guns on us.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Oh yah we do. Cause watch what happens if we don’t. They lower their guns. Instantly Bill and Ted try to run away - scrambling desperately for the door - then stoppin when they hear the loud clicks of the guns. 55 YR OLD BILL (CONT’D) See?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I have to admit, you were right. Quickly Ted grabs a guitar and swings it into older Ted - shoving him back into older Bill.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You dicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys race out the studio door and, unsure which way t turn, scramble down the hall and through --  51.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where they race past Bill’s Father - who is now sitting o his caftan on the floor (wearing his shabby, filthy cloth

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: (teary) Bill - where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you participated in this charade.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Bill. I miss your mother and I just wanted it all to be good again. Bill looks at his wan, pathetic father.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Hang in there, Dad - things will get better at some point. (trying to convince himself) I mean.. They have to. And he and Ted rush down--

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER HALLWAY
dialogues.text: But then come to a skidding halt when -- at the staircase the end -- they see OLDER BILL AND TED, blocking their wa

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: You guys can’t get away from us, you know.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Yah, cuz we totally remember everything you’re gonna do. Bill and Ted hesitate, then suddenly dive out a window. EXT. EDDIE VAN HALEN’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Bill and Ted roll, leap up, then stop when they see: on t roof, the 55 Yr Old thems are aiming guns at them.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/55 YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Told ya!  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars in the driveway, lights flashing. A cop is interviewing Eddie Van Halen. A third car squeals into th driveway and Deacon - ten years older now - jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn’t my brother and Bill.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Sorry, Deac. Deacon sighs, grabs a bullhorn and yells:

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Ted!! Come out right now, or I’1l have to call Dad!! EXT. BACK OF EDDIE VAN HALEN’S HOUSE - SAME The guys hear Deacon’s voice on the megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (yells) Deacon! It’s not me!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Yes, Deacon! It totally IS me!

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Deacon and the other cops - along with Eddie Van Halen - listen to the voices from the back yard:

dialogues.speaker: TED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This me talking is from ten years ago, and I don’t have anything to do with this!

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s totally true, dude! It’s the future us’s that you want!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shut up, Bill!

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You shut up, Bill! Deacon grabs his radio.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Dad, you gotta get down here.  53.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bill looks to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We gotta make a break for it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah, but how? They’re us - they remember everything we’re gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That means we gotta do something we can’t possibly remember.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How do we do that? Ted thinks a moment, then..

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude - check it out. Ted pulls his shirt up so his head is hidden. His arms flail.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I totally can’t see where I am! Bill nods - does the exact same thing. And now..

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted look at each other, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Oh no.. The head in shirt move.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I was hoping those younger us’s wouldn't think of it this time.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BELOW
dialogues.text: We HEAR Bill and Ted's voices as we see what basically lo like two headless bodies running in circles.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude! What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: TED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No idea! That’s the point!  54. They spin, sprinting in odd, random, chaotic, arbitrary directions - like pinballs - as they rush out the gate an start spinning down the alley.. Falling at times, bumping into each other, into walls.. Tripping, getting up.. For a moment Bill’s shirt drops.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh no! I can see! (then; pulling his shirt up) Spin me dude! I can’t know where I am! Ted spins him and pushes him over and now the two of them start ROLLING DOWN THE HILL - gaining speed..

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Into the swarm of police cars out front, CHIEF LOGAN screeches to a halt, jumps out, enraged.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Dad, I think Ted needs help. He was talking to himself like he’s two people--

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: This ends now. The lies, the delusions. I’m done with him. I’m done with both of them. (turns; gives the signal) Take them! Now! And the cops burst the door down and race into the house.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BACK OF PROPERTY
dialogues.text: 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted yell from the top of the hillside:

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: You guys are idiots! This woulda worked!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: You haven’t heard the last of us! We’re gonna get you, Bill and Ted! Suddenly cops come out, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons and get on the ground! Now! 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted turn to each other.  55.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Dude, there is no way I’m going back to jail.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Blaze of glory, Ted. And - like Butch and Sundance - they just start rushing d the hill, turning back and firing madly as --

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Get them! NOW! Police fan out, start moving, keeping cover.. Deacon and Logan turn and race back into Deacon’s police car, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted tumble to a stop against a wall and Bill and dizzily pull their shirts down.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - that totally worked!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah - maybe we should always not know what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We gotta try and get back to the booth.. Wobbly, they start up the hill, hearing GUNSHOTS, as--

dialogues.speaker: JUST UP THE HILL
dialogues.text: 55 Yr Old Bill and Ted scramble from the cops, firing, as police chopper sweeps the area with a searchlight and -- INT. DEACON’S POLICE CAR - DRIVING - SAME Deacon screeches around a turn, heading downhill.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Down there! Hurry! Go! Suddenly, in the wash of headlights, they SEE -- Bill and Ted, moving swiftly past them, uphill. Deacon slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn it around!  56. But it’s a narrow alley - it takes some maneuvering, as..

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Race up through some bushes and weave toward --

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Into which they leap and start frantically dialing.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We just gotta keep going further into the future! At some point, we’ll find the song.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ten more years?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes! Go! (seeing something) DUDE - what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a BRIEF INSTANT they think they see ROLLINS again - leaning against his silver phone booth across the street. But suddenly they’re AWASH IN BRIGHT LIGHT - from the HELICOPTER above them - as well as from -- DEACON’S POLICE CAR Which roars up - spotlight fixed on them. LOGAN’S VOICE (ON SPEAKER) TED! Step out of that phone booth, Ted!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Sorry dad! I’m not the me you want anyway! LOGAN’S VOICE I don’t want to hear it Ted! Come out right now!! Bill finishes dialing and the booth starts to shimmer.. FROM WITHIN DEACON’S POLICE CAR Logan squints into the bright light:  57.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What the hell? He grabs the spotlight from the side of the car - and tur it on. Now -- Its beam shoots forward - and connects with the shimmer o the phone booth. And in so doing, the sparks from the booth’s antenna travel along the beam of the light, until .-the police car itself begins to shimmer...

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Deacon - what the hell is going on??

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: I have no idea! Then, suddenly -- as the antenna on top of the police car sparks like the antenna on top of the booth..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other cop cars all screech to a halt as -- Deacon’s car VANISHES RIGHT BEFORE THEIR EYES. COPS, confused, scratch their heads and we cut to..

dialogues.speaker: THE CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: The phone booth careens past.. followed a second later by DEACON’S POLICE CAR Where Logan is apoplectic. He yells into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dad! You gotta go back! Put it in reverse! Deacon - go back! But the police car is catching up. The guys’ eyes widen a the police car is ABOUT TO collide with them when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flares past in a blur - missing the booth but nearly colliding with --

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Where Deacon cranks the wheel hard -- screaming -- as --

dialogues.speaker: INT. CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: The police car spins rapidly and..

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Godddddamnit Teeeeddddddddddd!!!! ..it whirls into a 360 and shoots off to the side and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD A BEAT on the vast, arid desert until..

dialogues.speaker: DEACON/LOGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh ..the POLICE CAR APPEARS and.. WHAM. It hits the ground w a thud. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan and Deacon - speechless and dazed - groggily look u

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we?

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POV
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD they see, a half mile in the dista the GREAT PYRAMID - about 2/3rds complete. Super: Egypt - 3000 BC Deacon and Logan just sit there, in the police car, takin in. For a while. Until we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth lands - somewhere - some flat, grey space. The guys look at each other, open the door.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Where are we, dude?  59. They look around in the fog, hearing something guttural a awful in the distance: low, grinding guitar - pounding, t can-like percussion. Death metal - at its darkest. They start toward the music. As they do, they become awar of FACES - HARDENED, HOLLOW-EYED MEN - in shadowy corners staring at them, as if waiting for something, anticipatin As they walk, MORE FACES become visible - denser now - shoulder to shoulder... Then two rows deep... four.. and. They start to hear snippets of a song.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I got a bad feeling about this. Behind the rows of men all watching them as they pass, th see barbed wire.. And guard towers.. and guards, with gun They’re in a PRISON. With everyone focussed on one thing: Bill and Ted, walking through the foggy, dimly lit yard, toward..

dialogues.speaker: TWO FIGURES
dialogues.text: who become more and more distinct as Bill and Ted approac Super: San Quentin, 20 years in the future

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted, in their mid-60's. Hardened beyond what we would ever have imagined: shaved heads, tattoos, heavily muscled. Bill grinds a guitar, Ted ‘sings’ - ferociously growling out the final words, which sound something like:

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: «+WELCOME..... WELCOME TO THE END. Then it ends. 65 Yr Old Bill and Ted look up with dead ey

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How’s it goin’, older incarcerated Bill and Ted?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: How'd you like our song? And yah - it actually is our song.  60.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: It’s very, you know, intense. Passionate. But is it the song?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Does that matter?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well, yah - if we’re gonna save the world.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Does that matter? 65 Yr Old Bill and Ted stare-- hard. The guys look at eac other, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So-- I think we'll be leaving now.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: It was really excellent seeing you guys, good luck with everyth-

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere, blondie.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: “Blondie?” Dude-- I’m you.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Like I care. The wall of prisoners has circled them and the men are staring - waiting for what seems to have been promised th

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Our friends here have been waiting for ten years for the chance to kick your asses.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Way, guy.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: “Guy?” You don’t even know my name?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I don’t care what your name is.  61. Prisoners pull out pipes, blades-- start to close in.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Seriously dudes, you can’t just let us get killed.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah - cuz if you do, then you totally won't exist.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: That is most nihilistic.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Stop saying that. Knives go up to Bill and Ted’s throats.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: See you in hell, guy.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay. Um. I don’t want to be argumentative here. But I don’t think there could be two souls of the same person in one hell.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Well, there’s two of us here.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Ted - don’t --

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: “Oh, I’m Ted and I’m a philosophical monist!”

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well, I am! And I knew you knew my name!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Ted - do not get drawn into this argument - we talked about this - Suddenly we hear a crackling and see a flash of light in sky. 65 Yr Old Bill looks at 65 Yr Old Ted with urgency. 65 YR OLD BILL (CONT’D) We gotta do this before that future guy shows up and --  Suddenly he freezes. As does 65 Yr Old Ted. And everyone else around them as.. Only Bill and Ted are able to move.
