Their eyes widen as ROLLINS steps out of the SILVER BOOTH and walks toward th now completely motionless scene..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How’s it goin’, dude?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bad.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We're looking. We’re trying to find the song.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Well whatever you’re doing is not working.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Sorry, dude..

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: I don’t care if you're sorry. There are a lot of people depending on you. You need to figure this out, and you need to figure it out fast.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How? We keep going further and further into the future and things keep getting worse and worse. (looking at his older self) I don’t even recognize myself anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I’m starting to think maybe there is no song. (pause) Is there no song?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. You have to figure this out yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We've like travelled through our whole lives almost..

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Have you?  63. A pause. The guys look at each other..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well, I guess not our whole lives..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Are you saying we should go.. to the very end? He just looks at them, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Like.. our end?

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: --FLASH -- Bill and Ted, in the phone booth - are seen briefly - worried - as it drops from view, revealing: Rollins, standing over the frozen scene, a look of grave concern on his face as he steps into his silver booth and whooshes away. As it goes.. .-the prisoners return to their natural movement.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - I told you not to have that argument with yourself!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I went out of my way to make sure it was shorter.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: It wasn’t! Ted - it was the exact same argument you had back then!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Maybe so - but he was so wrong! And I told you to stop me!

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: I was trying! I was yelling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 DOZEN SLAVES HAUL STONES on a GIANT WAGON up a hill alo NARROW PATH in the desert. Slavedrivers crack whips. Afte a moment of this we HEAR A SIREN BLIP and..

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (amplified) This is the San Dimas Police. Please stop what you’re doing and drop your weapon.  64. The Rear Slavedriver looks back, sees: The SAN DIMAS POLICE CAR behind it, its lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon and Logan just sit there, looking at the line of slaves blocking the road in front of them. Until..

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: So.. You gonna say it, dad, or am I?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: That Ted was right?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Just drop it. I want us out of here. NOW. (holds mic to his lips) I said - this is the San Dimas--

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) Dad --

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Fine. Frustrated - Logan sets the mic down, opens his car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slavedriver - and the slaves - all turn and gape as.. Logan emerges from the police car, putting in his billy c

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Have any of you men seen a phone booth circa USA approximately 1989? Phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: (rolls down window) Dad - it’s 5000 years ago - there’s no version of that that they understand.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (to slavedriver, who is raising his scimitar) If you draw that weapon I will arrest you, sir.  65.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Dad - you can’t arrest this guy. This is like three thousand BC.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (ignoring Deacon) Sir - this is your last chance. The guy - uncomprehending - raises his scimitar. Logan shakes his head - grabs his taser - and -

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Dad - this is a terrible idea As the slavedriver comes at Logan with his huge blade, Lo instantly shoots him in the bare chest with his taser. The guy shakes violently and crumples to the ground, wher lays there, twitching and writhing. The slaves are terrified. Another GUARD comes at Logan. Logan tases him too. But more and more guards are coming.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great. Now what are you gonna do? Logan grabs his GUN and FIRES IT INTO THE AIR. Which causes immediate and widespread panic.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WAGON
dialogues.text: The slaves scatter - the ones who were pulling the giant boulder. The ones who were securing it. It starts to move

dialogues.speaker: JUST BELOW IT
dialogues.text: Deacon’s eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I’m not quite done here -

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Logan turns -- sees the boulder dislodging and starting t roll. He turns quickly. And he dives back into --

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Where Deacon steps on the gas.  66.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: GO! Put it in reverse! But the tires spin in the sand and --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOULDER
dialogues.text: Gains speed and rolls off the huge wagon - all 25,000 pou of it toward --

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Which can’t get any traction.. As just as it starts to mo backwards -- -- CRUUUUUUUUNCH -- the boulder utterly crushes the car. Pause. Silence. The slaves and slavedrivers all stop and look as we hold the huge motionless boulder in the dust.. and then we cut

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: WE HOLD for a while. As our eyes adjust we begin to sense that we are in some kind of a deep, deep cave. Gradually we begin to SEE some reflected blue and red lig from above... and we HEAR an approaching SIREN.. as.. THE POLICE CAR plummets into frame - dropping and droppin down this seemingly bottomless hole. CAMERA DROPS WITH IT- for a while.. We see Deacon and Log sitting in the front seat -- too gobsmacked to scream.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: I think we were crushed by that giant boulder and killed. A pause. Logan looks around, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: So where are we then?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: My guess is we are falling to -- Suddenly there’s a loud WHOOOMPH as the car hits the grou and bounces a moment before stopping entirely.  67. As the dust clears around them we see red, fiery light playing off their faces as they look around and gape. And cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re outside a REST HOME as - FLASH - the shimmering pho booth appears and lands. Bill and Ted get out, approach t front door. Super: San Dimas, California, 50 Years In the Future

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted enter, turn and go down a hallway toward an door backlit with light. They cross and enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Where they step in and see.. in two beds, TWO VERY, VE OLD MEN-- 95 YEAR OLD BILL AND TED. Ancient, frail, in the final moments of their lives. They look up with grateful recognition as Bill and Ted enter.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (gently) How’s it goin’?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: All I can say is we’re so glad you’re finally here.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: And so happy to be able to share the song with you.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So then-- there is a song?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: As it turns out, there is.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: When was it written?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: A long, long time ago. You just didn’t recognize it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Is it.. good?  68.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: It’s amazing. You can’t imagine how proud you'll feel when you play it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: When do we play it?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Tonight. The guys look at each other, amazed, excited. Then..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Is there.. a title? The ancient thems look at each other.. Then back at the g

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: It’s called..

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: ..-Face the Music. The guys take this in. It’s clear it’s the truth. Exchanging a look, Bill and Ted separate.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (taking his older self’s hand) Bill.. I just want to say thank you for all the times you’ve been there for me..

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry for the times I let you down, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (voice catching) You never did, Bill, you never did. At the same time, on the other side of the room:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I feel like I never really knew you, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I know, that’s my fault. I never truly opened myself up to you. The truth is-- I looked at you and saw myself.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I know, me too.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: But now, as I reach the end, there’s so much that I want to say to you.  69. We hear crying and MOVE BACK TO THE BILLS. Bill is huggin his ancient, dying self, whose eyes are dimming.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Te adoro, Guillermo...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I‘ll never forget you, Bill. Ever. Bill looks over to Ted, who leans close to 95 Yr Old Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: There is one more thing we need to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: I know. Elizabeth and Joanna. (a pause; voice catching) We haven't seen them since the day they left.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh no, please don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: But I’m afraid it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Does it have to be that way? 95 Yr Old Ted takes Ted’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Unless you two change it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Can we?

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Of course you can. None of this has to happen.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Believe us: When the song is played, everything will change.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But how are we gonna play it? We don’t even know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Its with you. It’s with you right now.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Where?  70. 95 Yr Old Ted starts to point - but his hand drops. He lo at ancient Bill. They both nod ever-so-slightly, then loo back at their younger selves and say:

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Catch you later, Bill and Ted. And with that, they die. Bill and Ted stare for a long moment.. Then..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude-- In honor of our late selves, I propose that we get back to the Fabulous Forum and immediately play our song.. Ted nods. Meanwhile: IN HELL —- SAME The cop car cruises along, slowly, demons and anguished s peering in, crowding them, making it difficult to navigat Logan flicks the lights on top and BLIPS the siren a coup times. Then gets on the mic and says, amplified:

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Please move away from the vehicle. I repeat: please move away from the vehicle immediately. No change. If anything, it’s getting more difficult to mo

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Dad - that is lame. I mean, we’re in hell.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Now you’re telling me how to be a police officer. You gonna replace me there too?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Finally it comes out.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Finally what comes out, Deacon?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: That this is about Missy.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry - when you say “Missy” are you referring to your wife - or are you referring to my ex-wife? Oh - oh - I’m sorry - they’re the same person. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re tortured souls) You know what? Stop the car. I’m gonna deal with this. Logan pushes the door open and steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stands about a head or two ABOVE the hunched-over TORMENTED SOULS as TWO FEARSOME DEMONS approach and growl

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I need you to move these people out of the way, please. The Demons come toward him, eyes glowing.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm telling you to freeze right there, sir. Both of you. (as they keep coming) Consider yourselves warned. Now Logan removes his BEAN BAG GUN from his belt and FIRE THREE BEAN BAGS INTO THE FIRST DEMON’S CHEST, who falls o backward with a wail. The other demon keeps coming. Logan CLUBS HIM WITH HIS BILLY CLUB - then MACES HIM. As the De grabs his eyes, moaning, Logan reflexively cuffs him. Deacon exits, is now standing on the other side of the ca

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Good work, dad. What are you gonna do about the rest of them? Logan turns, sees what Deacon's referring to: Two HUGE DEMONS are lumbering menacingly toward them.. Logan looks out, then looks down at his weapons..

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Let’s get back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Good idea. They re-enter the car. Suddenly STARTLED as they see: Sitting in the back seat is DEATH, black-clad, white-face Very, very somber.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am “Death.” I knew your son and his friend Bill. We were band mates. 72. We sense in Death a kind of longing - he misses those eve brief good moments; the last (and only) ones of his life.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (very straight-faced) Man did I party hard. Too hard, it turned out. And the women. Whoo-boy. Yes, I was a player... He looks off, nostalgic.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (as Death turns back) Why are you here? Are you just here to reminisce? Because we actually need to find a way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Yes, I can help you. I’ve still got some ‘juice’ around here. This way. Death makes a gesture out the window and a slight path op As Deacon starts to drive:

dialogues.speaker: DEATH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So.. how is the band? Have the guys come up with the song yet?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No - and they never will. They're delusional.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Oh - you still think that?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: I know. That’s what I’ve been saying.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what-?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: (raising a hand) Excuse me. Gentlemen. Please. I get enough conflict down here. Can we just have some chill tunes?

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: You know, I think that’s a good idea.  73. Deacon turns on the CD player. JACK JOHNSON’S “BETTER TOGETHER” comes on.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Mnnn. Love me my Jack Johnson. He sits back, slightly moving to the beat as -- FROM A HIGH, WIDE SHOT: The police car cruises through he Jack Johnson music wafting up. HOLD a moment, then cut to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARQUEE reads “TONIGHT - WYLD STALLYNS presents ‘Two Decades of Triumphance!’"” There’s a FLASH in the sky, an moment later the booth lands and the guys jump out and ru towards the artists’ entrance. As they run..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I still don’t understand.. How are we gonna play the greatest song ever written when we don’t even know it?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, you heard us: we have it with us. We've obviously been over-thinking this. We just have to let it happen.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So we’re just gonna make it up as we go along?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Exactly. Ted nods, not totally convinced, as the guys hurry toward EXT. ARTISTS’ ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS The guys move quickly to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Gotta admit-- didn’t think you two’d actually show up. (into radio) They're here. Cut the house lights. Frank throws open a door marked “STAGE” and they push in in front of them, the arena dims. They look nervously at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Our world is about to change, dude.  74. They mount the steps toward the side curtains which block

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Which is lit. But the guys don’t see much of it - yet.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ready, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ready, Bill. And they stride past a curtain and onto..

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Which is totally empty. No mics. No instruments. Nothing. They stand in the glare of the bright lights on the total bare stage. It’s too dark in the audience to see out.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude.. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I don’t know.. Maybe we gotta keep going.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Going... where?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: To the mics.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: There are no mics.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I think we just gotta start.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ready? One.. Two..

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: One - two - three - four! Silence. They stand there - look at each other. Nothing coming int their heads.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Let's try again.  75.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay. One - two - three - four. Still nothing. Beat. They walk closer to the center of the stage. It’s like a very, very bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Hello? It’s utterly silent in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hello, Fabulous Forum? More silence. A beat. Ted turns to the side:

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um.. Could we have the house lights up? A beat later - a loud KA-CHUNK, and the guys stare out at

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE FORUM
dialogues.text: Which is completely empty. Not one ticket has been sold. Bored USHERS motionlessly man utterly empty tunnels. CONCESSION WORKERS stand idly behind their counters.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted just look around, confused, disoriented...

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t understand... DING DING DING, a warning light goes off on the timepiece TWO MINUTES LEFT. Suddenly the guys feel something strang Their feet are starting to move. They gape at each other terrified - as.. They begin sliding backwards - WHAM - into the phone boot Which lights up automatically and quickly SHOOTS DOWN thr the pavement and is gone. Revealing: ROLLINS, by his booth, watching. He steps back inside.. a WHOOSH.. It’s gone, too.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above, the sky starts to DARKEN ominously. LIGHTNING flashes.. Some cracks start to appear in the ground. We P

dialogues.speaker: THE 76 STATION ACROSS FROM THE FORUM
dialogues.text: Where a guy gets out of his car to pump gas and stops sho totally baffled as he sees: An EQUALLY CONFUSED ROMAN SOLDIER - in toga, with lst cen weaponry - just standing there, under the fluorescent lig of the gas station. Both men stare at each other, utterly confounded. And we to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark, white, quiet. As if we are up in the clouds. The POLICE CAR is parked. Deacon and Logan are standing, waiting. In silence. For a long while. Until, finally:

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Fine. Ted wasn’t wrong. (off Deacon’s look) He was right. Ted was right. Ted was.. totally, one hundred percent right. About everything. You happy? Deacon nods. Footsteps. Death approaches, exiting a heavy gold door.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: My bad. I thought I could get the gate key. But the truth is, the old man just got pissed. That’s the bad news. The good news? I just got scored a new Play Station which is pretty rad, and since we'll be spending a lot of time - like “eternity” - together--

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No. Absolutely not. I’m not staying here.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Well I’m afraid you don’t get to make the--  77.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No. No no no. My son is in serious jeopardy - and I have a job to do. He pushes past Death and through the gold door, which clo with a solid whoomph. Deacon and Death look at each other as, OFFSCREEN, we hea Logan's insistent, muffled voice - and a lower, booming, muffled voice - talking over each other. Death looks at Deacon, raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Wow. Your old man has a very big ball sack, bro. There's a brief beat of silence. Followed by a low PHHUP- PHHHHHUP, and then..

dialogues.speaker: OW-OWWWW. .
dialogues.text: Which is then followed by a very heavy THUD. And groaning And then Logan storms out, eyes straight ahead - jaw fixe holding a GILDED SKELETON KEY.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Did you just bean-bag God, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Yes I did. Get in. Deacon turns - follows his father to the car.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I'll try to smooth this out. Say hi to the fellas for me. And - oh - one thing. Can I keep that chill Jack Johnson CD? Deacon hands Death the CD, the police car screams away.. shimmers and disappears and we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --BANG - the phone booth lands, roughly, followed a half later by the silver booth. The guys get out - shaken - and find themselves face to f with the THREE GREAT LEADERS, who are scowling, furious.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: You have failed utterly.  78. Though inside the dome, we HEAR UTTER CHAOS coming from outside: thunder - the ground is quaking - screaming.. people in the dome are running.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why we ever put our hopes in you two idiots is beyond me. And he and the others turn, stride off. There is a final BEEEEEEP on the timepiece as it runs out. The guys just stand, looking down at it-- horrified, speechless. Then Rollins steps between them. They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen? Rollins indicates for them to follow.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE GUYS
dialogues.text: As Rollins leads them, shell-shocked, into the room which houses the TIMELINE.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: This is the new reality. He points all the way down towards antiquity.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoa.. The time line appears to be fraying: bending upward, twisting back in on itself, contorting - like a hose out control or a downed electrical line. The guys move closer. Ted touches it. Suddenly an image pops up: The BUDDHA is running in panic from -- A CAVEMAN - who catches him and CLUBS HIM on the head..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoooaaaa.. Dude-- the Buddha just got clubbed by a caveman. Bill moves forward, touches the timeline. We see the Last Supper -- 12 people sitting in a torch-lit tent. Suddenly two OMINOUS SHADOWS appear on the tent wall and we HEAR a pair of loud SCREECHES as a_FEARSOME CLAW suddenly tears tent. The 12 disciples leap and run as -- Bill turns to Ted:  79.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, if I’m not mistaken, I believe the Last Supper was just disrupted by a pair of velocirapters.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, no.. They cross together.. Look at the line.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude. It’s like everything is just blending together.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: It’s collapsing in on itself. Starting at the ends - and moving toward the middle.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: It’s in 1400 now.. Does that mean it’s about to hit..? The guys look at each other, then look toward medieval ti the 1400's - suddenly grasping something -

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You brought our families there.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: That I did.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted - it doesn’t matter now. We just gotta get there and get em back. Ted looks at Rollins - then follows Bill as..

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS RUN
dialogues.text: Through the chaos and into the phone booth and we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth appears on TOP OF A CASTLE WALL and Bill and Te leap out, suddenly stopping and reacting in horror.  80.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - look. WITHIN THE CASTLE, guarded by dozens and dozens of fearso looking KNIGHTS in armor who are brandishing swords-- Joanna, Elizabeth, Will, Theo - as well as the Duke and Duchess - are bound and are being led along SCAFFOLDING toward 6 NOOSES. The King stands nearby and shouts out over the chaos:

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: For bringing darkness into our world, this entire family must die! Bill and Ted look in the other direction: below them - OUTSIDE THE CASTLE - pounding on the gates and trying to down the castle walls - are: SOLDIERS FROM EVERY ERA - Trojan warriors, Incas, Nazis, Coats - you name it - all ramming the gates.. Scaling the walls.. pulling pins in grenades, etc. And more are comin from other directions.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude, what are we gonna do? There’s not just guards and executioners in the castle - but there’s like armies from all through history outside the castle.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I know. And we got like 30 seconds to figure it out and we’d need like 30 years!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But dude-- we don’t got 30 years to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (a beat) We don’t.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We don’t - cause we’re just starting to think about it now. But what if we start thinking about it thirty years ago?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How? We'd have to start when we’re like ten.  81.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (eyes widening) Whoa! Dude! That means, alls we gotta do is--

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: --go back and find ourselves when we're ten --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: -- when we actually have 30 years to think about it.. and get ourselves thinking about it! (turns ) Ted - you have had many ingenious ideas which on the surface seem counterintuitive. But this is the counterintuitivest of them all. Let’s go, dude. They jump back into the phone booth, quickly dial. With a flash, the booth disappears and we cut to: INT. BILL’S CHILDHOOD HOUSE - NIGHT VAN HALEN’S “RUNNIN’ WITH THE DEVIL” plays on the tape de as 10 year old Bill and Ted jump on the beds, playing air guitar and singing along. Super: San Dimas, California, 1980 The door opens and 14 YEAR OLD MISSY sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD MISSY
dialogues.text: You guys need to brush your teeth and get ready for bed. Your folks will be home soon, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: Okay, Missy. She puts her Walkman headphones back on, exits.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Dude, your babysitter is cute.

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: I know, remember when we were in kindergarten and she was in third and we asked her to the pumpkin dance?  82. They hear LOUD RAPPING on the window. There, outside, in shadows, desperate and frenetic, are adult Bill and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dudes! Let us in! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD TED
dialogues.text: Wh-who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Don’t worry! We’re you, it’s fine! The boys - terrified - turn and try to run out - but Bill Ted open the window and rush in and catch them at the doo

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dudes, listen to us. We're you. We're what you will become.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah - and we’re here to prevent you from destroying time and space as we know it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Not to mention destroying your marriages. And alienating your kids.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Elizabeth is gonna be the love of your life, Ted, and you’re gonna blow it. And Will and Theo will think you two are completely blind idiots, which you are.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You will be lonely beyond description without Joanna, Bill. Especially when mom walks out on you and never comes back.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But! Here’s the good news: It doesn’t have to happen.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah, alls you gotta do is take the next 30 years to figure out how to save your wives and sons and in-laws from being hanged in 1428! Simple, right?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But you gotta start now - like right now. The two boys are too stunned and scared to speak. Bill an Ted kneel down, get right in their own faces.  83.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So-- ARE you gonna spend the next 30 years figuring this out? Are you? Are you?? The two kids, looking like they’re about to cry, are so scared that they cannot even manage tiny little nods. Bil and Ted look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude, they’re not getting it. What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted shove their beyond-terrified, whimpering, trembling younger selves into the booth. As Ted dials.. A CAR screeches into Bill’s driveway and a woman (35, pre curly blonde hair) rushes towards them, yelling at the to her lungs--

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Bill’s jaw drops in amazement as the booth sparks.. Bill and Little Bill both press their faces to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But the shimmering booth is now dropping-- And just before it disappears, Bill notices that --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SWIRLING VORTEX
dialogues.text: Mrs. Preston has slipped and tumbled in and now --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: Bill is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh, no! I always knew I was responsible for my mom’s leaving.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude, you weren't.  84.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, I literally just was. Mom!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PRESTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (voice disappearing) BILLLLLL1111111111...... Bill and Little Bill stare in horror and we cut to..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth lands back on the parapet and.. Bill and Ted dr their 10 year old selves out of it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Bill: stop crying. Even though Mom's gone, I love you and I will always be there for you.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - you can’t promise that.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Okay - I won’t be there for you. But you are gonna have to be there for us.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. You guys have to see this. Gradually the terrified 10 year olds open their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. Is this burned on your brain? The kids stare down at the confusion: royal guards on the inside - soldiers from all of time on the outside, climbi the walls, clambering to get in. Their younger selves give horrified nods.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Good. Now. Here’s what you need to do:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: See those people down there? Those are your beloved wives and sons - and that’s their grandparents. They’re about to be hung by their necks till they’re dead.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You don’t want that to happen? Spend the next thirty years coming up with a plan to get us out of this.  85.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And do it fast. Cause we only got about thirty seconds and we don’t have any idea what to do.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Now get going. (swatting his young self on the ass) Get.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (shoving himself roughly)

dialogues.speaker: IW
dialogues.text: n. As they shove the kids back into the booth and speed-dial numbers -- And BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Even though space-time is unravelling - because of you - it doesn’t matter. You have to save them.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So don’t blow it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Don’t blow anything.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Do everything right, always. You two - alone - are responsible for saving everything. Okay? The booth is gone. Alerting the attention of TWO GUARDS WITH BOWS AND ARROWS, who turn, on the parapet, an start toward.. Bill and Ted - who quickly spot--

dialogues.speaker: A STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: and hurry into it, mulling what just happened as they rus down it.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think that went particularly well.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. I think in our desperation we came on a bit too strong.  86.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I know, midway through, I started to totally remember this whole thing from when it happened to us.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know. I’d always thought that was just some weird nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah - the worst nightmare of all time.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Totally. So bad that I musta completely blocked it out.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But now that we’re talking about it - it’s like in the back of my mind, I’ve always been thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know.. Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude. Is it even possible that it worked?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well.. What if we now have been thinking about this - subconsciously - for thirty years?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Then I guess we’d know more about what to do.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. Like.. I don’t know.. Ted reaches into his jacket packet and pulls out the LARG BLOB OF YARN.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude, you're gonna knit?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. I think I’m gonna just do.. This. Ted holds the yarn blob right in front of Bill - AND INSTANTLY - there’s a “THWOOK” - and A SPEEDING ARROW lod right in the blob - and not into Bill.  87.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! Suddenly Ted turns, shifts his arm, and - THWOOK-THWOOK - more arrows lodge into the blob. From the CASTLE GUARDS who'd just seen them on the parapet. They look at each other and now burst out a door and into

dialogues.speaker: A COURTYARD ON THE CASTLE GROUNDS
dialogues.text: Where it’s chaos: soldiers and denizens from all of time drop down over the walls and swarm, doing battle with the royal guards. Bill and Ted make their way out.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - you have been thinking about this! That must be why you’ve been making yarn blobs all these years!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! Yah! I wonder what you’ve been thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I look forward to finding out. Suddenly they both freeze as they HEAR LOUD VOICES IN ANC CHINESE and they turns slowly to see: 2 DOZEN HUNS stand before them, spears raised, with a LEA yelling in Mongolian.

dialogues.speaker: SUBTITLE
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted's eyes widen -

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa... Ted yanks a knitting needle, holds it “threateningly.” It does nothing. The Huns come closer. Suddenly -- AN OFFSCREEN VOICE YELLS LOUDLY IN ANCIENT MONGOLIAN.

dialogues.speaker: SUBTITLE
dialogues.text: The Huns look at the guys for a second.. And then move on pushing past.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa.. I didn’t even see who said that.  88. Bill looks at TED with a little smile. And then, with his mouth completely closed, he says:

dialogues.speaker: BILL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Me neither, dude!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! I’m not sure what’s more impressive: your ventriloquism, or your use of ancient Mongolian.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Thanks! And I spent that whole summer and only learned two phrases! I guess I won’t get to use the other one. (then, turning) Hing tak ga.

dialogues.speaker: SUBTITLE
dialogues.text: He steps aside as a Mongolian warrior moves past, almost hitting him. Gaining confidence now, they start moving again.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (pointing) Our families are just on the other side of that wall. Indeed - there’s a LARGE CASTLE WALL just on the other si of this courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How we gonna get through all this and over there? They see a HORSE-DRAWN CARRIAGE moving through the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Camp Weekhoko - summer of 83! They two of them race to the wagon and slide under - immediately get into “crab-walking” position (legs forwar hands behind, body facing up) and - using the carriage as “cover” -— they crab-walk exceedingly fast - scuttling fo under the carriage. They are very good at it. (And they know it.)

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - that whole summer - all the counselors were like “don’t you wanna do anything besides crab-walk?”

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: And we were like --  89.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Nope!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Now we know why. And they roll out - rise. Look at the wall - and then loo at TWO FELLED FLAG POLES which have just been knocked fro the walls.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pole vault!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Good idea, dude! They each grab an end of one of the long flagpoles and tr plant the pole, but they both just end up running along t pole with it sliding through their hands until they both plant at the other end of the wood.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know. I just remembered: we never learned how to pole vault!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Then why did we think these poles were a good idea? The guys look at the long wooden sticks they are holding their hands.

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted are STILT-WALKING - 25 feet in the air.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not sure this was such a good idea either. We’re still not high enough to get over the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know. And I feel somewhat vulnerable and exposed. Below them HORDES OF SOLDIERS are approaching their long, spindly wooden “legs.”

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Maybe we should wave to them like Uncle Sam.  90.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - what does Uncle Sam say?

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: (alternating, while waving) Good day citizens! Happy Fourth of July! We are Uncle Sam! We want you.. To stop trying to knock us over!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude - we have to remember to not have this misguided stilt-walking plan. Below them SOLDIERS whack the stilts. The guys teeter.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well there must be some reason we did it. They hear an o.s. SCREECH and suddenly see TWO HUGE, SCAL REPTILIAN CLAWED FEET rise up over the wall..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: That’s why! They reach up and grab the legs. Now look up and see the UNDERBELLY of a huge scaly flying beast. Below - the shadow of a PTERODACTYL moves toward the wall the guys rise up..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - I hate to even ask this question.. But how - and when - could we have learned how to ride pterodactyls?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’m not sure we did, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh, yah. They look at each other -- and then just fall to the grou with a double WHUMPF as we hear heavy wings flump away. EXT. CASTLE COURTYARD —- CONTINUOUS They look up. They are at the feet of the executioners -- just yards away from where their wives and children have their heads on blocks.

dialogues.speaker: BILL TED
dialogues.text: Joanna! Theo! Elizabeth! Will! Their families look up as Bill and Ted rise, full of confidence.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Stop, executioners.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Unhand our families. Now.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Bill?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Ted? Suddenly swords appear at their necks.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Apparently 30 years was not quite enough time.

dialogues.speaker: SCAFFOLDING
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted’s heads are placed in nooses next to the oth The guys look at their wives and sons.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Liz.. Will.. I’m sorry. We tried to save the world - but we failed.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (to Joanna and Theo) We tried to save you - and we failed that, too.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: I love you both. The King nods - the hangmen start away from the scaffoldi

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I must say - it’s darkly ironic that the name of the song we supposedly wrote is “Face the Music”..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (nods ) Cuz I think that’s what we’re about to do. There’s a beat. Will and Theo look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Wait - dad - what did you say the song was called?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Face the Music.  92. Now the women look at each other.. then at Bill and Ted.. grasping something. Below, the King gets in position for the execution.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Ted.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: What? The women nod to the boys, who are looking at their dads. And suddenly... it hits Bill and Ted like a tidal wave. T eyes widen. They look at their sons.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That's your song, isn’t it? Ted wriggles a hand free, manages to reach into his pocke and pull out the now-crumpled sheet of paper that he took from Will the night before. He unfolds it.. And opens it. It’s sheet music. Written o the top are the words “FACE THE MUSIC.”

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’ve had it in my pocket the whole time. Now, below, the King gives a signal. The executioners mov toward the lever - and begin to pull it..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That future guy was right, there is a song.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I just kinda wish we’d figured this out a bit sooner. They are all about to hang... when suddenly, from outside castle, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: AN AMPLIFIED VOICE
dialogues.text: Citizens of Medieval England, this is the San Dimas Police. Come out of the castle immediately. I repeat: Come out of the castle immediately. This is your last warning. Suddenly CANISTERS fly over the wall and pink TEAR GAS fi the air. People wheeze, cough, cry, as--  93. DEACON’S POLICE CAR crashes through a gate and drives int the castle courtyard, smashing into the base of the woode scaffolding.. bringing it all toppling to the ground. Logan jumps out, in a gas mask. As he frees the Logans an Prestons, the Duke and Duchess...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dad? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I was wrong about you, Ted - and I’m sorry - and we're all leaving. Come on. (then - to the Duke and Duchess) Chet Logan. Ted’s dad.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: John, and this is my wife Mary. Duke and Duchess of North Umberland. This while they rush through the melee - pile into the ca 5 in front, 5 in back. Deacon slams it into gear - and it accelerates, shimmers and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: Windblown, chaotic, lights swirling. Deacon tries to navigate as the car careens through - barely. The Duke is Logan's lap. Between them, the Duchess is on Theo’s lap. Bill and Ted are in the back with Joanna, Elizabeth and W

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Where are we going, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: The Fabulous Forum! Deacon cranks the wheel - the car shakes violently - as i crossing a bridge that’s an the brink of giving out.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: This is impossible! Suddenly a SILVER STREAK OF LIGHT FLASHES PAST THEM.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: What is that? The guys look forward -- it’s THE SILVER BOOTH. With Roll inside. He nods - beckons them to follow.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: It’s help.  94.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Follow him. Deacon does. And now, through the shuddering circuits of time, they swoop and swerve - until finally--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car drops to the ground in front of the Forum where the ground is shaking and cracking. They race out o the car --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Duck! And have to squat to avoid a pack of PIRATES who are firi muskets at come COWBOYS.. They all start moving with their families. As they pass t silver booth-- Rollins emerges - joining them. He carries two large case

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude - thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Do you think it’s too late?

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: We'll see. (then) My dad always said you'd figure it out, sooner or later. The guys slow..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Wait..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Is your dad.. Rufus? Rollins nods. And they all start through--

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Which is over-run with anachronistic madness. Logan billy clubs a Samurai. Deacon tases a Sabertooth ti Joanna beanbags a Nazi. Elizabeth pepper sprays George Washington.  95.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: My eyes! My eyes!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Sorry! Sorry! They make their way through, fending off whatever “obstac are in their way. Bill and Ted turn to Rollins..

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay - dude - you have to tell us now..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Why did you take our families back to

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: It was obvious that there was no version of you guys seeing what was right in front of you until it was no longer right in front of you. Bill and Ted look at him - and he points - indicating..

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Where in all directions it’s utter mayhem. Every century every epoch - crashing up against each other. The Forum is shaking - a crack is forming in its ceiling. Bill and Ted rise and walk on - joining Will and Theo.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You just play.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What do we play with? Rollins opens the two cases. The boys look inside: it’s Bill and Ted’s amazing guitars. The boys look at their da

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Those are your guitars.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: They’re yours now. The boys look at their moms.  96.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: It’s a great song, Theo. Just go ahead and play it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Wait. You’ve heard it?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Dozens of times.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: The thing is.. It’s kind of a.. Well, it’s a bigger sound.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Yeah - it’s not really something we can play on our own. We kind of need everybody.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I know it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Dad. Alls you gotta do is follow along. Bill and Ted look at each other. Nod. Pick up two other guitars that Rollins is handing them..

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I think we can do that. Joanna and Elizabeth sit at the drums and keyboard. Bill Ted remain just outside the limelight - but there, behind boys.. Who look at each other. Cross to center stage.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Ready, Will?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Ready, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: One..

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Two..

dialogues.speaker: WILL/THEO
dialogues.text: One two three four.. And from the VERY FIRST NOTE of the VERY FIRST CHORD..  97.

dialogues.speaker: ALL AROUND THE FORUM
dialogues.text: What began as the most violent, chaotic, out of control Altamont-like riot becomes the greatest Woodstock-type pe and love festival of all time. Fights stop. Soldiers put down their weapons, take seats. The crack in the ceiling recedes.. Fans start to fill in: from aisles, they take seats. Othe come in through the tunnels. Other people are suddenly there as well: Logan takes a seat up front next to the Duke and Duchess, MR. PRESTON, who nods - still bummed and lonely-looking. Missy is sitting with them. Deacon joins them. Bill and Ted look at each other - smile - beginning to ge feel for the music. They glance at their wives.. who smil back. As the song continues.. And Will and Theo begin to pick u their rhythm and confidence.. The arena continues to fill in more and more. Now there a 2,000.. Now 4,000.. Rollins watches from the wings as.. The Forum is now full -- except for a few empty seats by Bill’s father.. --until there’s a FLASH OF LIGHT and -- Dropping into one of the seats is..

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: MRS. PRESTON (at 75), who shimmers and drops plops down, right next to Mr. Preston.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRESTON
dialogues.text: Louise! ? They embrace joyfully. Then, suddenly, there are SIX QUIC FLASHES and, with them - like a crazy slot machine sudden paying off.. Six more Mrs. Prestons - in ages varying from 35 to 70 - the same row. MR. PRESTON (CONT’D) Louise?? Louise! ??  98. They all converge - hugging him. Ted looks at Bill - who is thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You got seven moms, dude! And now the music really kicks in. And the guys’ 95 year old selves couldn’t have possibly b more correct when they said Bill and Ted would never feel prouder in their lives. The family plays the song. The crowd is cheering, arms in the air, exultant, thrilled, singing along-- present at t pivotal moment of history and feeling it.

dialogues.speaker: THE FORUM
dialogues.text: As the song rolls on, rocking the giant stadium, we cut t

dialogues.speaker: THE YEARS ROLLING BY
dialogues.text: -- Five years into their new future, 25 year old Will and year old Theo are joined in the garage by 50 year old Bil and Ted. Joanna and Elizabeth enter with food. JUMP CUT T Ten minutes later - the entire family is playing. All six them - with Joanna and Elizabeth on piano and drums. Jump -- Ten years into the future. Same gang playing. But ther are TWO NEW PEOPLE: Will and Theo’s lovely young wives. W now join them. Cut to: THANKSGIVING DINNER.. With all of them.. And Deacon, Miss Logan, and Bill’s 7 moms. The Duke and Duchess. And Death and Rollins. And something else: TWO LITTLE GIRLS.. -- Fifteen years into the future. 60 year old Bill and Te with their now 5 year old GRANDDAUGHTERS on their laps. Teaching them simple chords on the guitar. Quick shots: kids growing; holidays; more music.. And finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 year old Bill and Ted, on rocking chairs, smiling, hap strumming guitars together as we PULL AWAY and see.. More GRANDCHILDREN sitting at their feet. And Joanna and Elizabeth - 95 now, too - at their sides. Will and Theo - now 75 - with them. There are GREAT GRANDCHILDREN..  99. even GREAT GREAT GRANDCHILDREN. The lawn is full, teeming with life. And that voice we heard at the very beginning of the movi belongs to 95 YEAR OLD BILL - who looks out, with 95 YEAR TED - at the generation upon generation of family before them.. They are completing the telling of a long, long story:

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD BILL
dialogues.text: And as they looked back on everything they’d done.. Everywhere they'd been.. Everyone they’d known...

dialogues.speaker: YEAR OLD TED
dialogues.text: There was only one word to describe it. There’s a pause. The old men look at each other - then ou at their children and their children’s children.. And smile. And say - quietly - and with deep conviction:

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Smiling, watching out over all of it.. with Joanna and Elizabeth now sitting at their sides, holding their hands And then cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. The rocking chairs are motionless. The house is no silent. And we.. Fade out. Roll credits. And then, after the very last credit.. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --FLASH. The PHONE BOOTH lands in the lawn of Bill’s childhood home. And out of it step.. 10 year old Bill and Ted. Who turn - sort of shell-shocke but now able to grasp the enormity of what just happened. They turn. Gradually. And take in the thing that just brought them here.. the PHONE BOOTH.  100. Wide-eyed, they look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: YR OLD BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoooaaaaaa.. And as they’re just about to start an exuberant AIR GUITA we CUT TO BLACK.
